properties.description: Properties of a network manager connectivity configuration

The network manager properties
Properties of the network security perimeter link resource.
Properties of the NSP access rule.
Properties of the network security perimeter profile
Properties of the NSP resource association.
The network security perimeter properties

access.description: Indicates the access allowed for this particular rule

description.description: A description for this rule. Restricted to 140 chars.

destinations.description: The destination address prefixes. CIDR or destination IP ranges.

direction.description: Indicates if the traffic matched against the rule in inbound or outbound.

displayName.description: A friendly name for the rule.

priority.description: The priority of the rule. The value can be between 1 and 4096. The priority number must be unique for each rule in the collection. The lower the priority number, the higher the priority of the rule.

protocol.description: Network protocol this rule applies to.

sources.description: The CIDR or source IP ranges.

kind.description: Whether the rule is custom or default.

properties.description: Indicates the properties of the security admin rule

deleteExistingPeering.description: Flag if need to remove current existing peerings.

description.description: A description of the connectivity configuration.

displayName.description: A friendly name for the resource.

isGlobal.description: Flag if global mesh is supported.

useHubGateway.description: Flag if need to use hub gateway.

kind.description: Whether the rule is custom or default.

properties.description: Indicates the properties of the security admin rule

kind.description: Whether the rule is custom or default.

properties.description: Indicates the properties of the security default user rule

description.description: A description of the network group.

displayName.description: A friendly name for the network group.

description.description: A description of the network manager.

displayName.description: A friendly name for the network manager.

direction.description: Direction that specifies whether the access rules is inbound/outbound.

fullyQualifiedDomainNames.description: Outbound rules fully qualified domain name format.

privateLinkResource.description: The PaaS resource to be associated.

profile.description: Profile id to which the PaaS resource is associated.

autoApprovedRemotePerimeterResourceId.description: Perimeter ARM Id for the remote NSP with which the link gets created in Auto-approval mode. It should be used when the NSP admin have Microsoft.Network/networkSecurityPerimeters/linkPerimeter/action permission on the remote NSP resource.

description.description: A message passed to the owner of the remote NSP link resource with this connection request. In case of Auto-approved flow, it is default to 'Auto Approved'. Restricted to 140 chars.

localInboundProfiles.description: Local Inbound profile names to which Inbound is allowed. Use ['*'] to allow inbound to all profiles. It's default value is ['*'].

remoteInboundProfiles.description: Remote Inbound profile names to which Inbound is allowed. Use ['*'] to allow inbound to all profiles. This property can only be updated in auto-approval mode. It's default value is ['*'].

description.description: A description of the rule collection.

displayName.description: A display name of the rule collection.

deleteExistingNSGs.description: Flag if need to delete existing network security groups.

description.description: A description of the security configuration.

displayName.description: A display name of the security configuration.

id.description: Subscription id in the ARM id format.

kind.description: Whether the rule is custom or default.

properties.description: Indicates the properties of the security user rule

destinations.description: The destination address prefixes. CIDR or destination IP ranges.

direction.description: Indicates if the traffic matched against the rule in inbound or outbound.

displayName.description: A friendly name for the rule.

protocol.description: Network protocol this rule applies to.

sources.description: The CIDR or source IP ranges.
